evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: On February 11, 2025, President Trump issued the Executive Order 14210 that is the subject of this lawsuit. Executive Order 14210 (hereinafter "Workforce Executive Order" or "Executive Order 14210") ordered all federal agencies to "commence[]" a "critical transformation of the Federal bureaucracy" for the purported purpose of "eliminating waste, bloat, and insularity."

extracted.value: Executive Order 14210 ordering large-scale RIFs without Congressional authorization

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: in late March, pursuant to the mandate of Executive Order 14210, the Department of Health and Human Services ("HHS") began eliminating more than 10,000 positions throughout the Center for Disease Control ("CDC"), Food and Drug Administration ("FDA"), the National Institutes of Health ("NIH"), among other programs, throwing the medical, public health, and scientific community into utter chaos.

extracted.value: HHS eliminating over 10,000 positions across CDC, FDA, and NIH

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: On April 15, 2025, the IRS was slated to commence RIFs ultimately totaling 40% of its workforce, including over 50% of the tax enforcement staff (the very staff that brings in revenue to the government).

extracted.value: IRS commencing RIFs totaling 40% workforce reduction with 50% tax enforcement staff cuts
